hero.subtitle: This interactive pitch deck explores the economic model behind Universe Dollar — a protocol where monetary creation is mathematically equal for every participant. Run the simulations. See the proof.

storyProblem.label: The Problem
storyProblem.p1: When central banks expand the money supply, the first recipients — financial institutions, governments, large corporations — spend at yesterday's prices. By the time new money reaches ordinary people, prices have already adjusted upward. Economists call this the Cantillon Effect. We call it a structural transfer of wealth from the many to the few.
storyProblem.p2start: The question is not whether this happens — it is measurable, documented, and ongoing. The question is:
storyProblem.p2highlight: how much has it cost you, personally?

storySolution.label: The Model
storySolution.p1: The Relative Theory of Money, formalized by Stéphane Laborde in 2010, demonstrates that there is exactly one class of monetary systems where no individual is structurally advantaged over another: systems where newly created units are distributed equally to all participants via a Universal Dividend.
storySolution.p2: Universe Dollar implements this framework on a blockchain layer. The simulation below lets you adjust the parameters — member count, growth rate, time horizon — and observe the mathematical invariants in real time.

storyProof.p1: Pick a country. See a standardized basket of essential goods — housing, energy, food, transport — priced in both the local fiat currency and UVD over time. The divergence is not hypothetical. It is arithmetic applied to publicly available inflation data from the World Bank, ECB, and FRED.

storyInstitutional.label: Beyond Individuals
storyInstitutional.p1: The Sovereign Basket is not just a personal hedge — it is a framework for states, pension funds, central banks, and multilateral institutions. Instead of pegging to a single reserve currency (typically USD), a nation can anchor its monetary policy to a diversified, transparent index of real-world value.
storyInstitutional.card1Text: A government can allocate reserves across gold, energy, agriculture, and stable fiat currencies — reducing dependence on any single geopolitical actor.
storyInstitutional.card2Text: Retirement funds denominated in a basket-indexed unit maintain purchasing power across decades — unlike fiat-denominated pensions that silently erode.
storyInstitutional.card3Text: International trade priced in a neutral, basket-indexed unit eliminates exchange-rate risk and the structural advantage of reserve-currency issuers.
storyInstitutional.p2: Below, you can construct your own basket. Drag in currencies, commodities, and real assets. Adjust the weights. Watch how the composition changes the stability metrics in real time — the same way a treasury or central bank would model its reserves.

storyLearn.label: Go Deeper
storyLearn.p1: Every term used on this site is precisely defined, with deep dives and primary source references. From the Cantillon Effect to Lazy Claiming — the glossary is your entry point into the economic theory behind the protocol.

storyClosing.p1: This companion site presents the economic simulations and research supporting Universe Dollar. For the full project — whitepaper, shortpaper, and roadmap — visit the official site.

glossary.title: Glossary of
glossary.subtitle: Precise definitions backed by primary sources. Understanding the language of money is the first step toward monetary sovereignty.

inflation.definition: The expansion of the money supply, which leads to a general increase in prices. Commonly misunderstood as 'rising prices' — prices are the symptom, monetary expansion is the cause.
inflation.deepDive: When central banks increase the money supply (via quantitative easing or lowering reserve requirements), each existing unit of currency represents a smaller fraction of the total. This dilution manifests as higher prices — but not uniformly. Assets (stocks, real estate) inflate first, consumer goods follow later.

cantillon.definition: The uneven distribution of newly created money. Those who receive new money first (banks, governments) benefit from old prices, while those who receive it last suffer from already-inflated prices.
cantillon.deepDive: Named after Richard Cantillon (1680-1734), this describes how money creation is inherently redistributive. In modern fiat systems, commercial banks create money through lending. Borrowers (corporations, real estate investors) receive purchasing power at pre-inflation prices. Wage earners — last in line — face higher prices with unchanged income. This is the core injustice that RTM addresses.

rtm.definition: A mathematical framework by Stéphane Laborde (2010) proving that the only monetary system ensuring spatial and temporal symmetry is one where money creation is distributed equally to all members via a Universal Dividend.
rtm.deepDive: RTM demonstrates that any money system respecting individual economic freedom must follow specific mathematical constraints. The key insight: if money creation is not symmetric (equal for all members), it creates involuntary wealth transfers. The Universal Dividend is not charity — it is the mathematically necessary condition for a free monetary system.

ud.definition: The equal share of newly created money distributed to each verified member of the monetary system. Calculated as: UD(t+1) = UD(t) + c² × (M(t) / N(t+1)), where c ≈ 10% annually.
ud.deepDive: The UD growth rate c is derived from human life expectancy (~80 years). It ensures that over a lifetime, no generation is advantaged over another. The formula guarantees that regardless of when someone joins, after one 'half-life' period, they hold roughly the same relative share as everyone else. This is temporal symmetry.

wot.definition: A decentralized identity verification system where existing members certify new members through personal relationships. Prevents Sybil attacks (one person creating multiple accounts).
wot.deepDive: Unlike Proof-of-Work (energy waste) or Proof-of-Stake (plutocracy), the Web of Trust bases consensus on human relationships. To join, a person must be certified by 5 existing 'Smiths' (validators). This ensures one-person-one-account without centralized KYC. Smith status requires ongoing community participation.

basket.definition: A standardized set of essential goods and services (housing, energy, food, transport) used to measure real purchasing power across currencies and time periods.
basket.deepDive: Unlike CPI (Consumer Price Index), which governments can manipulate through methodological changes (hedonic adjustments, substitution effects), the Sovereign Basket is transparent and fixed. Each community defines its own basket, enabling honest cross-country comparisons. UVD serves as the universal unit of account for these baskets.

timeEquity.definition: The principle that every person's time has equal monetary value in the creation process. UVD frames money creation not as income redistribution (taxes), but as a 'monetary birthright' — infrastructure, not welfare.
timeEquity.deepDive: Traditional framing of universal dividends as 'basic income' triggers political resistance (association with welfare). Time-Equity reframes: just as every citizen has equal access to roads, courts, and clean air, every person should have equal access to newly created monetary units. This is not redistribution — it is fair initial distribution.

lazyClaiming.definition: An on-chain optimization where instead of updating every account each block, a global UD Index is maintained. Individual accounts calculate their accrued UD only when transacting.
lazyClaiming.deepDive: If N = 1,000,000 members, updating each account every block would be computationally prohibitive. Lazy Claiming stores a monotonically increasing UD Index. When a user initiates a transaction, the runtime calculates: pending_ud = (current_index - user_last_claimed_index) × ud_per_unit. This is O(1) per claim instead of O(N) per block.

aboutUvd.whatText: Universe Dollar (UVD) is a protocol that implements the Relative Theory of Money — a mathematical framework proving that the only fair monetary system is one where every participant receives an equal share of newly created money. This equal share is called the Universal Dividend.
aboutUvd.howText: Instead of money being created by central banks and distributed unevenly (the Cantillon Effect), UVD distributes newly created units equally to all verified members. Verification happens through a Web of Trust — existing members certify new ones through personal relationships, ensuring one-person-one-account without centralized identity checks.
aboutUvd.whyText: In traditional monetary systems, those closest to money creation (banks, governments) benefit at the expense of everyone else. UVD's mathematical framework eliminates this structural inequality. The Sovereign Basket concept further ensures that purchasing power is measured against real goods — not against another currency that is itself inflating.
aboutUvd.whoText: The mathematical foundation comes from Stéphane Laborde's Relative Theory of Money (2010). The Universe Dollar project implements this theory. This companion site (uvd.trading) is an independent educational project by Prime Associates LLC. For the official project, visit uvd.xyz.

community.whatIsText: Universe Dollar (UVD) is a proposed cryptocurrency protocol described in a whitepaper published at uvd.money. According to the document, it implements the Relative Theory of Money (RTM) by Stéphane Laborde on a Bitcoin-anchored zero-knowledge rollup. The core concept: every verified participant receives an equal share of newly created currency units — the Universal Dividend.
community.whoText: The project is publicly represented by Kiyan Sasan. For official information and updates, follow his X profile (@kian_sasan). This companion site (uvd.trading) is an independent educational project by Prime Associates LLC and is not affiliated with the official project.
community.techText: According to the whitepaper, UVD would run on a custom zero-knowledge rollup that anchors state commitments to Bitcoin — not on Ethereum or Solana. It would use external price feeds (oracles) for basket valuation. As of now, there is no live implementation, mainnet, or token. The project remains in the conceptual/whitepaper phase.
community.debateText: The project has generated significant discussion in the crypto community. Forums and social media threads discuss the technical feasibility, oracle dependencies, and whether the project delivers on its promises. Opinions range from cautious interest to strong skepticism.

keyQuestions.q1: Is there a working product or only a whitepaper?
keyQuestions.a1: As of now, only a whitepaper and shortpaper exist. No live chain, no token, no testnet has been announced.
keyQuestions.a2: We cannot make that determination. The whitepaper describes a technically ambitious concept. Whether it will be delivered as described remains to be seen. As with any pre-launch project, caution is warranted.
keyQuestions.q3: What are the main technical risks?
keyQuestions.a3: Oracle dependency for price feeds, complexity of building a custom ZK-rollup on Bitcoin, and the absence of any working implementation are the primary concerns raised by the community.
keyQuestions.q4: How does this differ from existing stablecoins?
keyQuestions.a4: Unlike USDT or USDC which peg to the US Dollar, UVD proposes a basket-indexed unit with symmetric money creation. The mathematical basis (RTM) is well-documented academic work by Stéphane Laborde.

uwdReveal.metaDescription: Analysis of the UWD (United World Dynamics) sovereign reform framework and UDRP (United Digital Reserve Protocol) — the ecosystem behind Universe Dollar.
uwdReveal.title: The bigger picture
uwdReveal.subtitle: The uvd.xyz countdown revealed the full ecosystem: a sovereign reform guidebook and a digital reserve protocol. UVD is not just a currency — it's the first product of a much larger architecture.
uwdReveal.introText: At 01:00 CET on February 17, 2026, the countdown on uvd.xyz resolved, revealing two new domains: uwd.xyz and uwd.xyz/udrp. These publications position Universe Dollar within a dramatically broader vision — one that spans sovereign governance, infrastructure, and a new neutral reserve layer for the digital age.
uwdReveal.uwdShort: A guidebook for sovereign reform covering six pillars: Money, Infrastructure, Resources, People, Cohesion, and Governance.
uwdReveal.udrpShort: A sovereign settlement fabric for programmable CBDCs and a neutral reserve layer between nations.
uwdReveal.uvdShort: A Bitcoin-secured, basket-indexed, fixed-supply stable currency. The first concrete application built on the UDRP infrastructure.
uwdReveal.uwdText: UWD (United World Dynamics) presents itself as "How to Run a Country" — a comprehensive guidebook for sovereign reform. Rather than focusing solely on monetary policy, it addresses the complete architecture of a functioning state. The framework is built around six interconnected pillars, each representing a domain that must work in harmony for a society to thrive.

uwdReveal.udrpTitle: What is the United Digital Reserve Protocol?
uwdReveal.udrpText: UDRP (United Digital Reserve Protocol) is described as a "Sovereign Settlement Fabric for Programmable CBDCs and a Neutral Reserve Layer." It sits between the macro vision of UWD and the concrete currency product (UVD), providing the technical and institutional infrastructure where digital currencies can operate across borders without requiring trust in any single nation-state.
uwdReveal.udrpKeyFeaturesTitle: Key characteristics based on available information:

udrpFeatures.f1: Sovereign settlement fabric — designed for nation-state level interoperability, not just individual transactions
udrpFeatures.f2: Programmable CBDC compatibility — a layer where central bank digital currencies can interact through neutral infrastructure
udrpFeatures.f3: Neutral reserve layer — positioned as a non-partisan, non-sovereign base layer for international settlement
udrpFeatures.f4: Bitcoin-secured — leveraging Bitcoin's proof-of-work security as the ultimate settlement guarantee

uwdReveal.uvdContextText: With this reveal, Universe Dollar is no longer just a standalone currency concept. It is the first concrete implementation on top of the UDRP infrastructure, which itself operates within the UWD philosophical framework. Think of it as layers of a building:

analogies.a1: UWD is the architectural blueprint — the vision of what a well-run civilization looks like across all domains.
analogies.a2: UDRP is the foundation and plumbing — the settlement infrastructure that makes digital value transfer between nations possible.
analogies.a3: UVD is the first apartment — a Bitcoin-secured, basket-indexed stable currency that people can actually use, built on that foundation.

entropyNetwork.introText: In recent days, events on social media have been unfolding at breakneck speed. Between Instagram Stories, Reels, and viral threads on X (formerly Twitter), screenshots of a document that could shake the crypto world to its core kept surfacing: The Entropy Network Whitepaper (v0.8.1). entropyPillar.metaTitle: Entropy Network — Thermodynamic Settlement Layer by Kiyan Sasan
entropyPillar.metaDescription: Everything about the Entropy Network: Proof of Infinity consensus, thermodynamic settlement, o.day testnet, Whitepaper v0.8.1, and the connection to Universe Dollar (UVD).
entropyPillar.title: What is the
entropyPillar.subtitle: A thermodynamic base layer for universal settlement — designed to make governance optional and settlement a physical constant. Here's everything we know.
entropyPillar.overviewText: The Entropy Network is a proposed blockchain protocol described in Whitepaper v0.8.1 by Kiyan Sasan (dated February 19, 2026). Unlike conventional blockchains that rely on political governance models, the Entropy Network treats settlement as a thermodynamic process — using volatility as an 'entropy signal' to maintain stability through a mathematical 'Issuance Surface.' The protocol aims to be the base layer on which Universe Dollar (UVD) operates.
entropyPillar.pillarsSubtitle: What fundamentally distinguishes the Entropy Network from existing blockchains.

thermodynamic.title: Thermodynamic Settlement
thermodynamic.text: Settlement is treated not as a matter of negotiation but as a physical constant. Instead of governance votes deciding monetary policy, the protocol uses market volatility as an 'entropy signal' — feeding it into a mathematical Issuance Surface that automatically adjusts. Think of it like a thermostat for money: the system self-regulates based on thermodynamic principles, not human politics.
thermodynamic.detail: The whitepaper describes a model where price stability emerges from the mathematics of the system itself, not from active management. This is fundamentally different from algorithmic stablecoins (which failed, e.g. Terra/Luna) because it doesn't try to peg to anything — it creates stability through structural design.

zeroGovernance.title: Zero Governance — The End of Admin Keys
zeroGovernance.text: Kiyan Sasan's 'Iron Money' approach: no councils, no upgrade votes, no emergency buttons, no admin keys. The protocol is fixed at genesis. Changes are only possible through hard forks and voluntary user migration — ensuring no single entity can alter the rules after deployment.
zeroGovernance.detail: This is the most radical departure from existing crypto projects. Even Bitcoin has core developers who can propose changes. The Entropy Network aims for absolute immutability — a protocol that cannot be changed by anyone, ever. The only 'upgrade path' is a new fork that users voluntarily migrate to.

proofOfInfinity.title: Proof of Infinity
proofOfInfinity.text: An entirely new consensus mechanism optimized for minimal computational effort at maximum throughput. The goal: a system so lightweight it can be verified on 'smartphone-class' hardware. Not Proof of Work (energy waste), not Proof of Stake (plutocracy) — something fundamentally new.
proofOfInfinity.detail: While technical details are still limited, the whitepaper describes a consensus mechanism that scales without proportionally increasing resource requirements. If achieved, this would solve one of blockchain's fundamental trilemmas: decentralization without sacrificing performance or requiring industrial-grade hardware.

entropyPillar.odaySubtitle: A new domain has entered the ecosystem.
entropyPillar.odayText: On February 20, 2026, Kiyan Sasan publicly referenced o.day alongside uvd.xyz for the first time. The domain appears to be connected to the Entropy Network's testnet launch — a 'genesis calibration' countdown was spotted showing 03:06:40 until testnet launch.
entropyPillar.odayQuote: no one built uvd.xyz or o.day before me, not because they lacked intelligence, but because they were threatened, pressured, neutralized before they could even start.
